Description.Title: SoilTemperatureSWAT
Description.ExtendedDescription: Strategy to compute soil temperature by layers using the SWAT method (Soil and Water Assessment Tool). It applies a lagged update with a user-defined LagCoefficient and computes a damping depth as a function of bulk density, soil water content and soil profile depth. References: Neitsch, S.L., Arnold, J.G., Kiniry, J.R., Williams, J.R., King, K.W. Soil and Water Assessment Tool Theoretical Documentation, Version 2000 (http://swatmodel.tamu.edu/media/1290/swat2000theory.pdf). Component class: UNIMI.SoilT.Strategies.Soil.SoilTemperatureSWAT.
Description.ShortDescription: SWAT-based soil temperature profile computation with daily lagging.

Input.name: LagCoefficient
Input.description: Lag coefficient that controls the influence of the previous day's temperature on the current day's temperature

Input.name: SoilTemperatureByLayers
Input.description: Soil temperature of each layer (previous step values)

Input.name: VolumetricWaterContent
Input.description: Volumetric soil water content by layer

Output.name: SoilTemperatureByLayers
Output.description: Updated soil temperature of each layer

Function.name: Init
Function.description: Initialize SoilTemperatureByLayers to 15 degC for each layer.

Function.name: Estimate
Function.description: Compute soil temperature by layers using the SWAT method.
